Detailed Description

This class is used to linearly interpolate between two blends.

The BlendTransform is primarly used for blending from one animation to another smoothly.

void BlendTransform::blend ( float  ts,
const BlendTransform &  bt 
) [inline]

This function blends between this BlendTransform and the given BlendTransform by the supplied amount.

Parameters:
ts The amount to blend by.
bt The BlendTransform to blend with.

void BlendTransform::init ( const Matrix &  ma  ) 

This function initialises the rotation, scale and translation of the blend transform with the given matrix.

Caller must check BlendTransform::valid().

Parameters:
ma The matrix to extract rotation, scale and translation data from. The matrix must be invertible i.e. have a non-zero determinant.

void BlendTransform::normaliseRotation (  )  [inline]

This function normalises the rotation quaternion.

void BlendTransform::output ( Matrix &  mOut  )  const [inline]

This function outputs the rotation, scale and translation information into the input matrix.

Parameters:
mOut The matrix to insert the rotation, scale and translation information into.

Gets the rotation in the form of a Quaternion.

Gets the scale.

Returns:
Returns the scale as a Vector3.

void BlendTransform::translation ( const Vector3 &  translation  )  [inline]

Set the translation.

Parameters:
translation The translation as a Vector3.

const Vector3& BlendTransform::translation (  )  const [inline]

Gets the translation.

Returns:
Returns the translation as a Vector3.

bool BlendTransform::valid ( std::string *  reason = NULL  )  const

Returns true if this transform has a unit length rotation, a reasonable scale and a reasonable translation, otherwise returns false and writes reason to given string.
